newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT -T-bonds must wipe out 116-23 for upside.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT -T-bonds must wipe out 116-23 for upside.

text.p: The U.S. T-bond rally has reached a critical stage and decisive moves either side of the 116-23 level will dictate whether the bull run will falter or continue powering ahead, technical analysts said on Friday.

"This market is bullish as long as 116-23 isn't broken," said Jerome Bertrand, analyst at Credit Lyonnais in Paris. "If it holds, we could go to 117-01, but if we break below it, we will become bearish and go to 116-14."

By 0905 GMT, September T-bonds were unchanged at 116-24 with the market reluctant to make a definite move ahead of key July payrolls data due 1230 GMT. According to a Reuter poll, economists expect the data to come in at 193,000 after the 217,000 increase in June.
Bertrand said 116-23 was a moving average on hourly charts and 117-01 was the top of a Bollinger band. He said 116-14 was the bottom of the same band.
Bollinger bands are lines drawn at standard deviations around the price action, to give support and resistance.

Bertrand said above 117-01, there was little in the path of the bull run until 117-30. "In that case, it would be very bullish, but I don't think that will happen anytime soon -- perhaps in a week or two," he said.
Donna Liu, technical analyst at DKB International in London, agreed T-bonds were at a crucial stage.
"The whole picture is looking critical," she said. "The selling pressure has not been particularly strong, but these levels could still prove to be the top."
"On the other hand, we could still go to 120-00, 122-00, which is around 6.0 percent on the cash long bond."
Liu said if the market could stay above 116-17 for a few weeks, it would be very positive for the longer term.
Gerry Celaya, senior technical analyst at American Express Bank here, put moderate first resistance at 116-28/31 followed by a minor trendline at 117-07 and a firmer barrier at 117-22.
To the downside, he put initial minor support at 116-16/20 followed by a moderate prop at 116-00.
By 0925 GMT, December Eurodollars were up 0.005 at 94.220.
